intro: Bilabrella tangheana, commonly known as the Tanghean bilabrella, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the rainy season. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is often found in protected areas.
